intro: Coreopsis grandiflora var. saxicola, commonly known as the rock coreopsis, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and vibrant yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun and well-drained conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and gray-green in appearance. This variety is valued for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
